intro: Vincetoxicum muliense, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its showy appearance. Vincetoxicum muliense is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine.
